content: Hi! I'm responsible for ensuring that my company's (built-with-rust) product runs well on the upcoming arm macs. I'd be interested in trying out any sort of alpha-quality "barely-workable" version of rustc, finding bugs in the compiler and external crates, submitting patches, and etc. Any ideas on when a bare-minimum version of macOS+arm support might land in nightly, so I can begin testing? Thanks!

land in nightly

No plans or timeline.

any sort of alpha-quality "barely-workable" version of rustc

but also you can build it yourself following some instructions if you want.

No plans or timeline.

I'm definitely not looking for any sort of commitment or official response here; just a guess. But fair enough.

following some instructions

Yes! Any pointers here?
I'm working on slimming down some of the steps (libc and cc accepted my PRs)
then the next step would be to get a target file added to rust-lang/rust
And if you trust me, I can also just provide a zip file of the compiler

https://github.com/shepmaster/rust/tree/silicon-bootstrap/silicon

Nice, very well documented, thanks! I'll give this a try soon.

Hopefully you've seen https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73908

Yep, though I did miss some updates there. Now subscribed!

Thanks for all your work here!
